snippet: Ike Maxwell walks the streets of Elyria, Ohio, as if determined to break through life’s defensive line. Often he is shouting. But what is he trying to say?
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column profiles Ike Maxwell of Elyria, Ohio, black former high school football star whose fall into drugs and alcohol after his brother died in a 1975 police shooting is a reminder of the city's scars; Maxwell says that racism and prejudice continue to be a problem in Elyria, although not as overtly as in the past (Series: Donna's Diner).
lead_paragraph: Ike Maxwell walks the streets of Elyria, Ohio, as if determined to break through life’s defensive line. Often he is shouting. But what is he trying to say?

headline.print_headline: In the Hard Fall of a Favorite Son, A Reminder of a City’s Scars
headline.seo: This Land: In the Hard Fall of a Favorite Son, a Reminder of a City’s Scars
headline.main: In the Hard Fall of a Favorite Son, a Reminder of a City’s Scars
